title: Jerome Powell Lists Stock Fund, Local Government Bond Holdings for 2021
sub_head: The Fed chairman disclosed dozens of fund holdings for last year, before more restrictive investment rules for central bankers kicked in this May
body:
Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell listed holdings largely made up of stock funds and local government debt in his financial disclosure statement for 2021.
Mr. Powell’s disclosure doesn’t show any transactions in individual stocks or other securities. His form lists a number of transactions in funds for municipal debt securities as well funds that hold collections of stocks. Some of Mr. Powell’s transactions don’t have trade dates listed, but a Fed spokesperson said those transactions are tied to automatic reinvestments, a practice permitted by the government ethics office.
